name: JavaScript
description: Language that can be used in a browser or in a server (see Node.js); In the browser it can be used to control HTML/CSS
Language that allows a developer to apply a set of design rules, including font, colour, size, position and layout of a HTML document
name: CSS (Cascading Style Sheet)
Favicon
description: Image displayed inside the browser next to the website page title

name: iframe
description: Effectively is window to a website inside a website; Expect extreme slowdowns in performance and possible security risks. Best standards strongly recommend NOT to use this. Despite this warning, there are bad websites which still do this, for example SalesForce, hence why Veeva SalesForce is hard to navigate.
An environment to view a project for review before deploying to a live environment
name: Staging
Package
description: To prepare and make available the final output of a project (build files). Usually you compress the project build files into a .zip & name it per naming conventions (usually Client_Brand_Project_What_DD-MM-YY.zip)
The digital development of an asset.
name: Build

description: When something's gone wrong, there's an Error
name: Error

description: When something has gone wrong, or you see a de-ja-vu in the matrix
name: Glitch

description: An error in a digital asset, affecting its correct function. See Jira.
name: Bug

description: Irrelevant or unsolicited messages sent over the Internet, typically to large numbers of users, for the purposes of advertising, phishing, spreading malware, etc. Also a tasty formed meat found in tins.
name: Spam
Lag
description: Word to indicate a slowdown or delay, might be applied to the UI or a late response to an interaction, such as from a Server

name: Jank
description: Similar to Lag, but specifically when the UI freezes during scrolling or animations

name: Push/Pull/Commit
description: Interactions with Git version control
Closed Loop Marketing platform - a method of digital content dissemination and analytics tracking. Usually discussed in the context of a interactive detail aid
name: CLM

description: Customer Relationship Management
name: CRM

description: A web banner that is 300px x 250px in size
name: MPU

description: A web banner that is 728px x 90px in size
name: Leaderboard

description: A web banner that is typically 120px x 600px in size
name: SkyScraper

description: A defined layout that can be re-used with different data input.
name: Template

description: An email distribution system that facilitates very granular analytics monitoring
name: Campaign Monitor

description: A closed-loop marketing platform for e-detail aids, previously used by GSK before they moved to Veeva
name: Skura

description: Veeva is a Closed Loop Marketing platform, used to distribute Digital Sales Aids to Sales Reps iPads. Currently used by Janssen, AstraZeneca, Gilead and Allergan.
name: Veeva

description: A technology and services company - major involvement with the Hive Group is either sales data or remote interactive detail aids
name: Cegedim

description: In the context of the Hive Group, a Closed Loop Marketing (CLM) platform used by some of our clients. Also a company who broader multi-channel marketing (MCM) company
name: Agnitio

description: Analysis of data, predominantly in the form of assessing digital assets. See metrics.
name: Analytics

description:
1. In software, it's the analytical data / numbers behind usage. 
2. In networking it's a set of properties on a communication path. 
3. In Maths it's an abstraction of the notion of distance in a metric space
name: Metrics

description: The number of people who only access a single page within a digital asset before leaving - assumed to have absorbed no content. See analytics.
name: Bounce Rate
Node.js
description: Modern server software that uses JavaScript
An open-source web application framework for dynamic web pages
name: ASP.NET

description: Adobe CQ5 is an enterprise level Content Management System (CMS) used by some of our clients to house and run their dotCom websites.
name: CQ5

description: A Programming language, used primarily for native Mac & iOS Applications.
name: Objective-C
GDS
description: Global Design Services, …

name: DC
description: Design Centre, …

name: DCOE
description: Digital Centre of Excellence, …

name: KC
description: Knowledge Centre, …
Project tracking software from Atlasian (https://www.atlassian.com/software/jira)
name: JIRA
Browser
description: A browser allows users to visit websites by downloading HTML, CSS, JS and other assets and rendering them on the screen

name: Cross Browser
description: Term used to mean a website should work across multiple browsers
Front end technologies are those run locally on your machine. Such as HTML & CSS - E.g. not on the server such as PHP & .NET
name: Front End

description: A digital term relating to the digital code/process/program not directly accessible by the end user, which contributes to the functioning of a digital asset
name: Back End

description: Experience in both Front-end and Back-end web development
name: Full Stack

description: Verson control system as used in Tech
name: Git

description: A central area code is 'pushed' to at various stages, allowing you to roll back to any of the stages in the future.
name: Version Control

description: The files used to create a website/app, before any compiling or deployment has been made. These are used to create and edit the project.
name: Source Files

description:
Cache in technology terms is the temporary storage of files on a device, to help them load quicker. For example, web browsers use cache, by storing images and web pages on your computer, so that they don't need to be re-downloaded. 

When testing anything in a web-browser, it's always best to ensure that you have cleared your cache, to ensure that you are testing the latest version.
name: Cache / Caching

description: Discouragement of use of some feature, design or practice; typically because it has been superseded or is no longer considered safe - but without completely removing it or prohibiting its use.
name: Deprecated (tech)

description: A server running to deliver webpages to the web
name: Web Server

description: Uniform Resource Locator
name: URL

description: A domain name, is a name given to a location point so you can access it without needing to know the IP address. Such as www.hivehealth.com (Please see DNS for more information)
name: Domain

description: Domain Name System - Will convert a Domain name (e.g. www.hivehealth.com) into an IP address which can then be accessed)
name: DNS

description: A link to a website / email address
name: Hyperlink

description: HTTP is the foundation of data communication for the World Wide Web. HTTPS is the secure version, over SSL.
name: HTTP / HTTPS

description: File transfer protocol. Pretty much an old skool dropbox.
name: FTP

description: Application Program Interface - routines, protocols and tools that specify how software components should interact
name: API

description: Asynchronous JavaScript and XML - a set of web development techniques used to make web applications
name: AJAX

description: Web accessibility refers to the inclusive practice of removing barriers that prevent interaction with, or access to websites, by people with disabilities. When sites are correctly designed, developed and edited, all users have equal access to information and functionality.
name: Accessibility

description: The technique of keeping a website still functional and with a good aspect on older browsers with some features altered/removed
name: Graceful Degredation

description: The methodology of designing and building for mobile 'first', and desktop 'second'
name: Mobile First

description: Meaning the design/layout has a fixed width, e.g. 900 pixels wide. It does not adjust/change depending on browser/device size
name: Fixed Width Layout

description: Defines the amount of pixels being displayed on the screen. E.g. iPads are 1024x768 (which is 1024 pixels horizontally times by 768 rows vertically)
name: Resolution (Screen)

description: A user has viewed a page of a website/app.
name: Page View

description: If you are trying to create a website with fonts that appear on a large percentage of computers, then you need to use a “web safe font”. While there are only a few fonts that are found on virtually every computer out there, if you use these fonts in your font stacks, your web pages will look correct.
name: Web Safe Font

description: Font's that are included natively on a system, and do not require any additional download by the user.
name: System Font
Prototype
description: A proof of concept

name: Tech Prototype
description: Proof of concept to check if functionality is possible
Metadata is small amounts of data (e.g. a tag) that describes bigger data.
name: Meta Data
GUI
description: Graphical User Interface;  Old term and pronounced 'Goo-ey', same definition as UI and applied more strictly for something shown on a screen

name: UXD
description: User Experience Design
Adobe Photoshop File. Adobe Photoshop is a digital tool used to manipulate images and create mock-ups for build. This is predominantly used within the Creative Team.
name: PSD
PNG
description: Image with PNG encoding; High quality images with optional transparency

name: JPG
description: Image with JPG encoding; Great for photos, usually lower resolution

name: GIF
description: Image with GIF encoding; Can be also animated, usually for low resolution images
A file format used for watching videos on PC - used in some version of DivX
name: AVI

description: A video file format, used natively by Quicktime
name: MOV

description: A video file format
name: MP4

description: An compressed audio file format
name: MP3

description: A video file format (Flash)
name: FLV

description: Adobe Flash is a (now defunct) multimedia and software platform used for creating vector graphics, animation, browser games, rich Internet applications, desktop applications, mobile applications and mobile games. He's also the saviour of the universe. https://youtu.be/LfmrHTdXgK4?t=17s
name: Flash
6Ds
description: The end to end process and all the stages we go through as an agency. Discover, define, design, develop, deliver and drive.

name: AASLD
description: American Association for the Study of Liver Disease

name: Above the line
description: This kind of marketing has a very broad reach and is largely untargeted. Think about a national TV campaign, where viewers across the nation see the same advert aired across the various networks.

name: ABPI
description: Association of the British Pharmaceutical Industry

name: ABR
description: Anti-biotic resistance

name: Amends
description: Amendments to be made to work.

name: APASL
description: Asia-Pacific Association for the Study of the Liver

name: Archive
description: Where old files and folders are kept.

name: Below the line
description: This kind of marking targets specific groups of people with focus. For example, a leaflet drop in a specific area, a Google Adwords campaign targeting a certain group or a driect telemarketing campaign targeting a specific business.

name: BHBIA
description: British Healthcare Business Intelligence Association

name: CMAP
description: End to end trafficking system we use as an agency. It deals with timelines, resourcing and finance.

name: COP
description: Close of play

name: CSR
description: Clinical study report - Another GSK term.

name: Detail Aid
description: This is a digital tool which sales reps use when visiting HCPs to see in a product's specific features/benefits features/benefits for patients. A.k.a. eDetail and sales aid

name: Distributor Markets
description: Markets where our primary client has sold the marketing rights for their product to another pharma company (e.g. Gilead own Viread, but GSK promote it in Eastern Europe).

name: DTC
description: Direct to consumer

name: EBMT
description: European Society for  Blood and Marrow Transplantation

name: EASL
description: European Association for the Study of the Liver

name: ECCMID
description: European Congress of Clinical Microbiology and Infectious Diseases

name: eDetail
description: This is either a printed or digital tool which sales reps use when visiting HCPs to see in a product's specific features/benefits features/benefits for patients. A.k.a. sales aid and detail aid

name: EDF Guidelines
description: European Dermatology Forum Guidelines

name: Efficacy
description: The ability of a drug to produce the desired therapeutic effect.

name: EMEA
description: Europe, Middle East and Australia

name: EOB
description: End of business (end of day)

name: EOD
description: End of day

name: EOP
description: End of play

name: ESCD
description: European Society of Contact Dermatitis

name: Fist or Five
description: This is an activity that GSK do at the end of a meeting (sometimes) to give everyone the opportunity to say if they felt the meeting was beneficial. Everyone puts their hands in a circle – if you put your palm flat (five) you think it’s beneficial, if you put a fist in (fist) you thought it was a negative meeting.

name: Greenhouse
description: To develop an idea. This is mostly a GSK term

name: HCP
description: Healthcare professional eg: Doctors, Nurses, Nutritionists etc.

name: IDA
description: Interactive detail aid/sales aid/eDetail

name: IDI
description: In-depth interviews

name: IPO
description: This is a GSK term to discuss a meeting agenda. It stands for ‘Input / Process / Output’ and describes what you need for each section of a meeting.

name: KOL
description: Key Opinion Leader

name: KPI
description: Key Performance Indicators

name: LATAM
description: Latin America

name: Leavepiece
description: A printed item that you leave behind with someone after a discussion. Usually left with an HCP by a rep following a sales call.

name: Let's socialise that
description: Means share our thoughts with other people to see what they think.

name: LOC
description: A GSK acronym. Stands for local operating country.

name: Meeting in a box
description: This rarely gets delivered in an ACTUAL box! It’s a ‘toolkit’ of contents which helps to standardise the running of meetings. It can include anything from a template agenda, discussion guide, slide kits, videos, stimulus, feedback forms. Can be delivered in a printed format, or often just as clearly labelled deliverables on an FTP site.

name: MSL
description: Medical Sales Liaison. This is a medical member of the salesforce, that doesn’t hold promotional conversations with customers. In contrast to a ‘rep’ that holds the promotional conversations, a MSL will instead talk about data or market shaping for a particular drug.

name: MVP
description: Most valuable player

name: NoC
description: Notice of Commission

name: OS Ticket
description: These are raised when one requests work to be done within 48hours that was unforeseen not is therefore not in the resourcing sheet.

name: PO
description: Purchase Order - required for an external company to raise an incovice.

name: QA
description: Quality Assurance

name: Referencing
description: The act of linking or connecting statements, data, ideas, or objects to an article or publication that refers the reader to another passage or source.

name: RFP
description: Request For Proposal. A type of bidding solicitation in which a company or organization announces that funding is available for a particular project or program, and companies can place bids for the Request For Proposal

name: ROI
description: Return on investment

name: RPC
description: Reply paid card. These are often used in relation to return on investment.

name: SAC
description: Statistical analysis complete - GSK lingo for when they read out the results of a big study. This is different to the publishing of that data though, so it’s still limited who they can share the information with and in what setting.

name: Safety
description: The freedom from being exposed to risk, danger, or harm.

name: Sales Aid
description: This is either a printed or digital tool which sales reps use when visiting HCPs to see in a product's specific features/benefits features/benefits for patients. A.k.a. eDetail and detail aid

name: Self-led detail
description: This is normally a digital tool (e.g. website) which HCPs visit to learn about a product's specific features/benefits features/benefits for patients. The main differences between this and an eDetail/sales aid/detail aid is that it is used by HCPs without the assistance of sales reps. Consequently is more interactive.

name: SmPC
description: Summary of product characteristics

name: SOW
description: Statement of Work

name: TC
description: Teleconference. NOT tactical chunder!

name: Through the line
description: This kind of marketing is really an integrated approach, where a company would use both BTL and ATL marketing methods to reach their customer base and generate conversions. It might seem obvious, although not all marketing campaigns are like this - some are ATL only and some are BTL only (it would be much more common to see a BTL-only marketing campaign in practice though).

name: Tolerability
description: The freedom from side effects

name: Webex
description: This is an online meeting which we can set up and host. It allows you to share your screen with a client, and also provide dial-in details to speak over the phone too.

name: WIP
description: Work in progress

name: Artwork
description: Any visual design on a project excluding copy.

name: Layout
description: General posistioning of creative content on a piece of work.

name: Copy
description: Any written content

name: Creative Brief
description: Document outlining key requirements for a job eg: aims, insights, outputs.

name: UI
description: User Interface design is the process of crafting a visual language and hierarchy that allows someone to use and engage an application. Tangibly, this might be designing a series of buttons or navigation icons for an iPhone app. Initially, these icons might be placed in skeletal form within a wireframe; UI Design is the process of ‘prettying the pixels up’ and bringing aesthetic beauty to functional user experience.

name: UX
description: User Experience. This is the process of considering and defining the fundamental usability and accessibility of a given product or service. One example of this would be considering how to navigate and interact with a website. User Experience typically happens before design and concurrent to content development.

name: Wire Framing
description: The task of producing a skeletal structure for a given webpage, application or other digital asset – typically early in its development. A wireframe can serve multiple purposes, including: defining the common structure of a page or page types, providing guidance to a copywriter both before and during content development, and codifying the wider user experience of an asset.

name: Strategy
description: A plan of action designed to achieve a long-term or overall aim.

name: RACI
description: Responsibility assignment matrix. This details who is responsible, accountable, consulted and informed. I.e. who is involved in a project

name: Accrued
description: Accumulation of payment or benefits over time.

name: Actuals
description: A physical commodity that underlies a futures contract or is traded in the physical market.

name: AER
description: Annual Equivilant Rate

name: Deferred
description: Temporal postponement of the payment of an outstanding bill or debt usually involing repayment by installments.

name: OOPS
description: Out of pockets/Pass throughs

name: Pass throughs
description: Out of pockets

name: POCN
description: Purchase Order Change Notification

name: Recognised
description: The billable hours that are approved by a BUD for any given project or role.

name: YTD
description: Year to date

name: Reconciliation
description: The action of making financial records consistant. Normally used when referring to the finance tracker.

name: Timesheet
description: A method of recording the amount of an individual's time spent on each job.

name: Concept
description: The finance system. Used for raising a PO,  timesheets and forecasting budgets.
